title: Christine McGuiness braves cold weather in jumper and miniskirt
text:
Does she realise it’s October? (Picture: Backgrid)

As the weather continues to get cooler across the UK, Christine McGuiness is not bothered by it in the slightest, as she made another bold choice fashion statement while out in Cheshire.

The Real Housewives star looked the part as she headed out to the KP Aesthetics treatment centre in the village of Hale, rocking a black jumper and glittery miniskirt embroidered with white buttons, which she paired with black boots and black knee-high socks, while carrying a white handbag.

And she clearly was not feeling the cold weather at all, as she did not wear a coat and chose to sport a huge pair of sunglasses instead.

She does realise it’s October, doesn’t she?

In fact, Christine previously ventured out earlier in the week wearing just a vest with a plaid mini-skirt, again rounding off her look with sunglasses.

Advertisement

Is she in a parallel world to the rest of us where Cheshire experiences warmer weather in October? Is she immune to winter? We may never know – but we have to give her props for braving the weather in such a daring choice of clothing for this time of year.

The star is known for taking a risk with fashion, as she also recently donned a sparkly blue see-through dress at Manchester Fashion Festival earlier in the month.

And in August, she transformed herself into a Barbie doll for a Real Housewives Of Cheshire fancy dress party, wearing a pink PVC dress with a harness across the chest.

Christine wore black jumper paired with a sparkly skirt (Picture: Backgrid)

She was not afraid to sport a pair of sunglasses either (Picture: Backgrid)

The star was visiting the KP Aesthetics centre in the Cheshire village of Hale (Picture: Backgrid)

Christine, who is married to TV personality Paddy McGuiness, recently admitted that she fears for her husband’s life when he is busy presenting Top Gear.

‘I do worry about him,’ she told The Mirror. ‘When he got it [the job] my first thought was, “Oh my god, I really hope he’s sensible”, because obviously I want him to be careful. I tell him not to go too fast.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He’s pretty good at driving. We’ve usually got the kids with us. He’s very sensible, but when he’s on the show he goes back to being a boy in a car.’

Christine and Paddy have been married since 2011, and they have three children together: six-year-old twins Penelope and Leo and three-year-old Felicity.
